title: Brexit vote 'costing households £400 per year' - Leicester Mercury

Households in the UK are losing £404 each year due to higher costs of products after the EU referendum, a study suggests. 
The average home is losing £7.74 per week due to inflated prices, according to analysis by the Centre for Economic Performance, 
The largest price rises are for product groups with high import shares including bread, milk, coffee and beer. Research states Brexit is causing issues before it has even happened 
Co-author of the report, Dr Thomas Sampson from the Centre for Economic Performance, said: "Even before Brexit occurs, the increase in inflation caused by the Leave vote has already hurt UK households. 
"Our results provide compelling evidence that, so far, UK households are paying an economic price for voting to leave the EU." 
According to results, due to depreciation and other effects of the referendum, the Brexit vote increased aggregate inflation by 1.7 percentage points the following year. Read More
